original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares jump in mid day trade on banking and tourism
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares jump in mid day trade on Thursday, on banking sectors and tourism counters, an analyst said.

Sri Lanka has seen a revival in tourism as the island nation recorded 143, 039 tourist arrivals for July, the highest monthly arrivals recorded for the year, data from the Tourism Development Authority showed.
In the first seven months, Sri Lanka welcomed 767, 913 visitors, compared to 719, 978 in the previous year.
India accounted as the top tourist traffic generator accumulating 16 percent of the total arrivals.
The main All Share Price Index was up 1.15 percent or 131.62 points to 11,578.45, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 1.92 percent or 63.70 points to 3,384.76.
Top gainers during 1230 hours were Commercial Bank, Sampath Bank & Hatton National Bank. (Colombo/Aug03/2023)
